projects.name: Z1025-8125 Leesville Road
conditions: Increased side yard and rear yard setbacks
Installation of a six foot wall and tree buffer
Exemption from block perimeter and dead-end street requirements
Minimum roof pitch of four and 12
Inclusion of at least two materials in future residential development front facades
projects.opposition: Eric Hungate, vice president of the HOA for Westlake at Country Trail, expressed concerns about disjointed development, stormwater management, and lack of detailed plans
projects.staff_recommendation: Consistent with the comprehensive plan and future land use map
projects.previous_action: Case was deferred to allow the applicant to consider additional conditions

key_people.name: Worth Mills
key_people.notable_positions: Presented updated conditions and a concept plan for the development

key_people.name: Eric Hungate
key_people.notable_positions: Expressed opposition to the project due to safety concerns, disjointed development, and stormwater management issues

newsletter_highlights: The Z1025-8125 Leesville Road project is under review with a deadline for action set for August 23rd.
The project has faced opposition from local residents, particularly regarding stormwater management and the potential for disjointed development.
The applicant has proposed several conditions to address concerns, including increased setbacks, a speed hump, and specific architectural requirements.
